title: Add Pin/Unpin Option To Panels
body:
I suggest that panels be closed by clicking outside their bounds and instead use the pin / unpin option to keep panels open or closed.
I think adding this feature will help both improve the user experience and speed up the use of this tool.
author: hassan-hamidi

comments.body: very good Idea, to keep panels open when user click on Pin Icon.

title: Add Option For EnableTimer
body:
Adding the Enable timer option is a very interesting idea and I suggest giving the user the ability to manage that time. 
For example, they can change the display time between 0.5 and 5 seconds.
author: hassan-hamidi

comments.body: Thanks, I will add a new overlay panel, then user can change the time of fading.
it is live now. thanks for your feature.

title: Collapse All Toolbox When Hidden Button Clicked
body: When the "HideAll" button is clicked, all tools except "EnableTimer" are hidden. Since that tool is also useless in this mode, I think it is better to hide both "EnableTimer" and automatically switch to the Release tool.
author: hassan-hamidi

comments.body: It is Live now.
thanks.

title: Thinnest line thickness
body:
I am testing Riter on a digital whiteboard in classroom.
I find that the minimum line thickness (1x) in free writing is still too great: when I write words, they do not always read well because of the thickness of the line.
Would it be possible to have a smaller minimum line thickness? Perhaps not half the current one but a 3/4?
Thank you for the great work you are doing on this tool!
author: mauriva

comments.body:
Thank you for your feedback, Yes, I will add it soon.
is it ok 0.8 or 0.7 current Ink size?

Thank you for responding immediately to my request: I really appreciate it!
On my PC 0.7 seems OK, but I have to test it on the digital board at school.
When I manage to do that I will definitely give my feedback.
Thanks again!

title: Self-Contained app
body:
I would like to be able to use Riter on a PC where I don't have administrator privileges and can't install anything.
However, Riter requires Windows Desktop Runtime to function, which I can't install on those PCs.
Is there a way to create a portable version that can be run on a Windows PC even if the Runtime is not installed?

Thank you!
author: mauriva

comments.body: it is duplicate.

title: Self-Contained app and "Move" shapes button
body:
I really appreciate that Riter is in portable mode, which is very useful for me.
I would like to be able to use it on a PC where I don't have administrator privileges and can't install anything. However, Riter requires Windows Desktop Runtime to function, which I can't install on those PCs.
Is there a way to create a portable version that can be run on a Windows PC even if the Runtime is not installed?

Regarding the program's features, I am requesting one that seems to be missing at the moment. Once something is drawn (for example, a line), I would like there to be a "Move" mode that allows you to drag and move what has been drawn.

Than you!

thanks again for your time to test and use it.

title: Drawing "undesired" shapes in mouse mode
body:
I am following the development of this tool with interest and have briefly tested various versions, including the latest 0.2.4 on Windows 11 24H2. In all the versions I tested, I noticed what I consider to be a bug. Hereâ€™s what I do:  

1) I start Riter and draw something on the screen (freehand, lines, rectangles, ...)  
2) I select the command to use the mouse normally (first button on the left)
3) In "mouse" mode, by clicking (multiple times) on the drawn shapes, almost always Riter starts drawing shapes again (especially rectangles!) even though the corresponding button has not been selected.  

I don't understand if this happens only to me or if it is indeed a bug in the program.
author: mauriva

title: The issue of the keyboard not working during program execution
body: When I open the program, even after changing the shortkey buttons, some of the keyboard keys do not work. For example: _D_ and _E_.
author: NimaKaviyani

comments.body: we have to change this code to revert key listener from OS to app focused.

Instead of using RegisterHotKey, we can use a global keyboard hook to listen for key events. This way, we can monitor key presses without intercepting them and can choose whether to handle them or allow them to pass through to other applications.
